definition: deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to wallow in alcohol and sex (idiom); overindulgence in wine and women/an incorrigible drunkard and lecher

sentences.english: Mr. Smith steeps himself in ancient history.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯沉湎于古代史中。

sentences.english: The young movie star revelled in the public's admiration.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的电影明星沉湎于观众的赞美声中。

sentences.english: Dont ruminate on past affronts or injustices.
sentences.chinese: 莫要沉湎于过去所受的侮辱或者不公平。

sentences.english: Tom loved to indulge in reveries about his future.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆喜欢沉湎于幻想其未来。

sentences.english: I filled my lungs, luxuriating in the sensation.
sentences.chinese: 我深呼吸，沉湎于感情中。

sentences.english: Let us not wallow in the valley of despair.
sentences.chinese: 我们切莫再沉湎于绝望的深谷之中。

sentences.english: You should not indulge in knitting sweater, especially when you are enjoying noodles.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该沉湎于打毛衣，特别是当你正在享受面条时。

sentences.english: It indulges in what we fear the most.
sentences.chinese: 它所沉湎的，正是我们最惧怕的。

sentences.english: MUSIC festivals are typically a great excuse for revellers to enjoy a bit of drunken debauchery.
sentences.chinese: 音乐节日通常是狂欢者沉湎酒色的主要理由。

sentences.english: JUST for this week, indulge in a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 就在本周，人们都沉湎于一个幻想之中。

sentences.english: There are people so addicted to exaggeration that they can't tell the truth without lying.
sentences.chinese: 有些人沉湎于夸张，以至于他们不说谎就讲不了真话。

sentences.english: He idled all day long,indulging in fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 他整天无所事事，沉湎于幻想之中。

sentences.english: He entered society, gave the day over to merrymaking and wallow in among them.
sentences.chinese: 他踏进社会，寻欢作乐，沉湎其中。

sentences.english: These playboys riot in dissipated living.
sentences.chinese: 这些花花公子整天沉湎于花天酒地的放荡生活。

sentences.english: Don't ruminate on past affronts or injustices.
sentences.chinese: 莫要沉湎于过去所受的侮辱或者不公平。

sentences.english: He went out into the world and sought out the pleasures that youth delights in.
sentences.chinese: 他步入社会后，便到处寻欢作乐，沉湎于声色之中。

definition: to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
to free oneself/to extricate oneself from a difficult situation
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
